data.title: Actor Bob Hoskins dies, aged 71
data.meta_description: Bob Hoskins, the world’s favourite Cockney gangster, has died of pneumonia at the age of 71.  He had every disadvantage facing him when he decided to become an actor and yet rose to be one of
data.text:
Bob Hoskins, the world’s favourite Cockney gangster, has died of pneumonia at the age of 71.

He had every disadvantage facing him when he decided to become an actor and yet rose to be one of Hollywood’s best-loved stars. “I came into this business uneducated, dyslexic, 5ft 6in, cubic, with a face like a squashed cabbage,” he said five years ago. “And they welcomed me with open arms.”

Today, they lined up to pay tribute to a man who was best known for his roles in such films as The Long Good Friday, described by Stephen Fry as “one of the best British films of the modern era”, and Who Framed Roger Rabbit.
